contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox protected area of Australia | name = Savage River National Park | iucn_category = II | image =Australia Tasmania location map blank.svg | caption = | locator_x = 90 | locator_y = 160 | nearest_town_or_city = [[Savage River, Tasmania|Savage River]] | coordinates = {{coord|41|21|14|S|145|24|33|E|type:landmark_region:AU}} | area = 179.8 kmÂ² | established = 1999 | visitation_num = | visitation_year = | managing_authorities = Tasmania Parks and Wildlife Service | official_site = [http://www.parks.tas.gov.au/natparks/savage/index.html Savage River National Park] }} '''Savage River''' is a national park in [[Tasmania]] ([[Australia]]), 233 km northwest of [[Hobart, Australia|Hobart]]. It is the largest undisturbed area of [[temperate rainforest]] in Australia. The Savage River National Park was created as part of the [[Regional Forestry Agreement]] in 1999 to allow natural processes to continue undisturbed, consequently visitors will find there are no recreational facilities or developments inside the reserve. The reserve is approximately 5% of the greater [[Tarkine]] area, and is a habitat rich in tiger snakes and very heavily leech infested. ==See also== * [[Protected areas of Tasmania (Australia)]] * [[Tarkine]] * [[Tasmanian temperate rain forests]] {{National parks in Tasmania}} [[Category:National parks of Tasmania]] [[Category:Protected areas established in 1999]] [[Category:North West Tasmania]] [[Category:1999 establishments in Australia]] {{Tasmania-geo-stub}}
